intro: Pimpinella schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many plants with aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its slender stems and small white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Pimpinella schlechteri is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
